text:
Day Trading Stock Picks for Week of July 13 Use your key for the next article Day Trading Stock Picks, DANG Daily Chart Finviz.com 
Day trading stock picks almost guaranteed to move big each day during the week of July 13. $ZIOP $SGYP $BBG $DANG $BAS 
We screen for stocks with a recent history of volatility. That means these stocks are highly likely to move big each day for the next week. 
What can you expect from these day trading stock picks: greater than 5% moves intraday (most days) more than 2,000,000 average volume (recently) all stocks; no leverage ETFs Price between $5 and $150 
This list is typically published before the Tuesday open on VantagePoinTrading.com under the Stock Trading category, and is valid till the following Tuesday. Watch for a new list to be published every Tuesday morning. 
These are day trading stock picks worth watching. I'm not recommending a specific trade or direction. For some guidance on day trading the stock picks discussed below, see the Day Trade Trending Strategy and Truncated Price Swing Strategy . 
Trading volatile stocks isn’t for everyone. It takes quick reflexes and fast execution to take advantage of the large percentage moves in these stocks. 
Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP) 
Producing 5%+ average movement days. Average volume over 3 million shares. Optionable and shortable. 
Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP) 
Move 6%+ most day for the last three week, on several million shares per day. Low volatility day is still typically 3%+. Lower volume days can occur. Optionable and shortable. 
Bill Barrett (BBG) 
Moving more than 5% most days in the last six weeks. Typically trades 1.5 million shares +. Optionable and shortable. 
China DangDang (DANG) 
Since the start of June this has traded over 2 million shares per day and sees 5%+ moves each day. Optionable and shortable. 
Basic Energy Services (BAS) 
2 million shares average volume and typically seeing daily ranges of 4%+. Optionable and shortable. 
Got a volatile stock you like day trading/found? Let us know in the comments section. 
Losing trades WILL happen. Don’t risk more than 1% of your trading account on a trade (risk = difference between entry price and stop loss price, multiplied by number of shares). Slippage is likely in these stocks. Make sure the stock can support the position size you wish to trade. Failing to do so could result in further slippage.
